topic.title: Create a Cluster with the cf-mgmt Tool

body.p: Not all cluster management and creation features are available through the Horizon console. The cf-mgmt tool can take direct input or leverage a bootstrap file to simplify cluster creation and expansion.
To minimize the risk of error, avoid creating huge clusters all at once. Best practice is to create a core and then expand it. The following are examples on how to create a cluster and grow it:
Create small cluster with one core node and one DEAs
Add a DEA to existng cluster.
Add a service to existng cluster.

section.note: For convenience, copy the code blocks and paste them into a text editor. You can edit them there and then copy and paste back into the cf-mgmt tool as necessary. You may also want to refer to the full cf-mgmt tool command reference documentation.
